Dear Tiger families;

Missouri Governor Mike Parson released a statement today that all schools would close for the remainder of the year. While this is something that we in Excelsior Springs feared might happen, it still raises questions about what this means for the rest of the school year. As of now, we will continue to offer remote learning through the end of the year. We also plan to offer food service to students as long as we can do so safely as determined by local and state health officials.

We realize you will have many questions about how this will impact the last day of school, cleaning out lockers, graduation, employees leaving for summer, etc... Please know that as soon as we get clarifications from the State Department of Education, and have decisions in place, we will provide guidance to address everyone's questions. This is what we know as of today, but expect regular communication in the coming week.

Here is a link to the Governor's press conference if you'd like to read it: https://www.kansascity.com/news/politics-government/article241897376.html
